arabic_text: صٓۚ وَٱلۡقُرۡءَانِ ذِي ٱلذِّكۡرِ
phonetic: 38.1 Şād Wa Al-Qur'āni Dhī Adh-Dhikri

footnotes.english_saheeh:
[1316]- See footnote to 2:1.
[1317]- The completion of the oath is understood to be that the Qur’ān is inimitable and thus a miracle from Allāh.

translations.english_saheeh: Ṣād.[1316] By the Qur’ān containing reminder...[1317]
translations.english_hilali_khan:
1. Sâd.
[These letters (Sâd etc.) are one of the miracles of the Quran and none but Allah (Alone) knows their meanings]. By the Quran full of reminding.
translations.english_rwwad: Sād. By the Qur’an, full of reminder,

arabic_text: بَلِ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْ فِي عِزَّةٖ وَشِقَاقٖ
phonetic: 38.2 Bali Al-Ladhīna Kafarū Fī `Izzatin Wa Shiqāqin

translations.english_saheeh: But those who disbelieve are in pride and dissension.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Nay, those who disbelieve are in false pride and opposition.
translations.english_rwwad: yet those who disbelieve are in arrogance and dissension.

arabic_text: كَمۡ أَهۡلَكۡنَا مِن قَبۡلِهِم مِّن قَرۡنٖ فَنَادَواْ وَّلَاتَ حِينَ مَنَاصٖ
phonetic: 38.3 Kam 'Ahlaknā Min Qablihim Min Qarnin Fanādaw Walāta Ĥīna Manāşin

translations.english_saheeh: How many a generation have We destroyed before them, and they [then] called out; but it was not a time for escape.
translations.english_hilali_khan: How many a generation have We destroyed before them! And they cried out when there was no longer time for escape.
translations.english_rwwad: How many generations We destroyed before them; they cried out when it was too late for deliverance.

arabic_text: وَعَجِبُوٓاْ أَن جَآءَهُم مُّنذِرٞ مِّنۡهُمۡۖ وَقَالَ ٱلۡكَٰفِرُونَ هَٰذَا سَٰحِرٞ كَذَّابٌ
phonetic: 38.4 Wa `Ajibū 'An Jā'ahum Mundhirun Minhum Wa Qāla Al-Kāfirūna Hādhā Sāĥirun Kadhābun

translations.english_saheeh: And they wonder that there has come to them a warner [i.e., Prophet Muḥammad (ﷺ)] from among themselves. And the disbelievers say, "This is a magician and a liar.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And they (Arab pagans) wonder that a warner (Prophet Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) has come to them from among themselves. And the disbelievers say: "This (Prophet Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) is a sorcerer, a liar.
translations.english_rwwad: They wonder that a warner has come to them from among themselves, and the disbelievers say, “This is a magician and a liar!

arabic_text: أَجَعَلَ ٱلۡأٓلِهَةَ إِلَٰهٗا وَٰحِدًاۖ إِنَّ هَٰذَا لَشَيۡءٌ عُجَابٞ
phonetic: 38.5 'Aja`ala Al-'Ālihata 'Ilahāan Wāĥidāan 'Inna Hādhā Lashay'un `Ujābun

translations.english_saheeh: Has he made the gods [only] one God? Indeed, this is a curious thing."
translations.english_hilali_khan: "Has he made the âlihah (gods) (all) into One Ilâh (God - Allâh). Verily, this is a curious thing!"
translations.english_rwwad: Has he made all gods into one God? Indeed, this is something strange!”

arabic_text: وَٱنطَلَقَ ٱلۡمَلَأُ مِنۡهُمۡ أَنِ ٱمۡشُواْ وَٱصۡبِرُواْ عَلَىٰٓ ءَالِهَتِكُمۡۖ إِنَّ هَٰذَا لَشَيۡءٞ يُرَادُ
phonetic: 38.6 Wa Anţalaqa Al-Mala'u Minhum 'Ani Amshū Wa Aşbirū `Alá 'Ālihatikum 'Inna Hādhā Lashay'un Yurādu

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1318]- Planned by Prophet Muḥammad (ﷺ) in order to gain influence and prestige for himself.

translations.english_saheeh: And the eminent among them went forth, [saying], "Continue, and be patient over [the defense of] your gods. Indeed, this is a thing intended.[1318]
translations.english_hilali_khan: And the leaders among them went about (saying): "Go on, and remain constant to your âlihah (gods)! Verily, this is a thing designed (against you)!
translations.english_rwwad: The leaders among them departed, saying, “Carry on as you are, and stay faithful to your gods. Indeed, there is a motive behind it.

arabic_text: مَا سَمِعۡنَا بِهَٰذَا فِي ٱلۡمِلَّةِ ٱلۡأٓخِرَةِ إِنۡ هَٰذَآ إِلَّا ٱخۡتِلَٰقٌ
phonetic: 38.7 Mā Sami`nā Bihadhā Fī Al-Millati Al-'Ākhirati 'In Hādhā 'Illā Akhtilāqun

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1319]- Referring to Christianity or possibly the pagan religion of the Quraysh.

translations.english_saheeh: We have not heard of this in the latest religion.[1319] This is not but a fabrication.
translations.english_hilali_khan: "We have not heard (the like) of this in the religion of these later days (i.e. Christianity). This is nothing but an invention! [Tafsir Al-Qurtubi]
translations.english_rwwad: We have not heard of this in the last religion. This is nothing but a fabrication.

arabic_text: أَءُنزِلَ عَلَيۡهِ ٱلذِّكۡرُ مِنۢ بَيۡنِنَاۚ بَلۡ هُمۡ فِي شَكّٖ مِّن ذِكۡرِيۚ بَل لَّمَّا يَذُوقُواْ عَذَابِ
phonetic: 38.8 'A'uunzila `Alayhi Adh-Dhikru Min Bayninā Bal Hum Fī Shakkin Min Dhikrī Bal Lammā Yadhūqū `Adhābi

translations.english_saheeh: Has the message been revealed to him out of [all of] us?" Rather, they are in doubt about My message. Rather, they have not yet tasted My punishment.
translations.english_hilali_khan: "Has the Reminder been sent down to him (alone) from among us?" Nay, but they are in doubt about My Reminder (this Qur’ân)! Nay, but they have not tasted (My) Torment!
translations.english_rwwad: Has the Reminder been sent down to him from among us?” Rather, they are in doubt about My Reminder, for they have not yet tasted My punishment.

arabic_text: أَمۡ عِندَهُمۡ خَزَآئِنُ رَحۡمَةِ رَبِّكَ ٱلۡعَزِيزِ ٱلۡوَهَّابِ
phonetic: 38.9 'Am `Indahum Khazā'inu Raĥmati Rabbika Al-`Azīzi Al-Wahhābi

translations.english_saheeh: Or do they have the depositories of the mercy of your Lord, the Exalted in Might, the Bestower?[1320]
translations.english_hilali_khan: Or have they the treasures of the Mercy of your Lord, the All-Mighty, the Real Bestower?
translations.english_rwwad: Or do they possess the treasuries of the mercy of your Lord, the All-Mighty, the Bestower?

arabic_text: أَمۡ لَهُم مُّلۡكُ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضِ وَمَا بَيۡنَهُمَاۖ فَلۡيَرۡتَقُواْ فِي ٱلۡأَسۡبَٰبِ
phonetic: 38.10 'Am Lahum Mulku As-Samāwāti Wa Al-'Arđi Wa Mā Baynahumā Falyartaqū Fī Al-'Asbābi

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1321]- To oversee the affairs of their dominion.

translations.english_saheeh: Or is theirs the dominion of the heavens and the earth and what is between them? Then let them ascend through [any] ways of access.[1321]
translations.english_hilali_khan: Or is it that the dominion of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them is theirs? If so, let them ascend up with means (to the heavens)!
translations.english_rwwad: Or do they have the dominion of the heavens and earth and all that is between them? Then let them ascend by any means.

arabic_text: جُندٞ مَّا هُنَالِكَ مَهۡزُومٞ مِّنَ ٱلۡأَحۡزَابِ
phonetic: 38.11 Jundun Mā Hunālika Mahzūmun Mina Al-'Aĥzābi

translations.english_saheeh: [They are but] soldiers [who will be] defeated there among the companies [of disbelievers].
translations.english_hilali_khan: (As they denied Allâh’s Message) they will be a defeated host like the Confederates of the old times (who were defeated).
translations.english_rwwad: This is only a small army among several armies that will soon be defeated.

arabic_text: كَذَّبَتۡ قَبۡلَهُمۡ قَوۡمُ نُوحٖ وَعَادٞ وَفِرۡعَوۡنُ ذُو ٱلۡأَوۡتَادِ
phonetic: 38.12 Kadhabat Qablahum Qawmu Nūĥin Wa `Ādun Wa Fir`awnu Dhū Al-'Awtādi

translations.english_saheeh: The people of Noah denied before them, and [the tribe of] ʿAad and Pharaoh, the owner of stakes,[1322]
translations.english_hilali_khan: Before them (were many who) belied (Messengers) - the people of Nûh (Noah); and ‘Âd; and Fir‘aun (Pharaoh) the man of stakes (with which he used to punish the people),
translations.english_rwwad: Before them, the people of Noah, ‘Ād, and mighty Pharaoh rejected [their prophets];

arabic_text: وَثَمُودُ وَقَوۡمُ لُوطٖ وَأَصۡحَٰبُ لۡـَٔيۡكَةِۚ أُوْلَٰٓئِكَ ٱلۡأَحۡزَابُ
phonetic: 38.13 Wa Thamūdu Wa Qawmu Lūţin Wa 'Aşĥābu Al-'Aykati 'Ūlā'ika Al-'Aĥzābu

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1323]- That were defeated, among whom will be the disbelievers of Quraysh and others.

translations.english_saheeh: And [the tribe of] Thamūd and the people of Lot and the companions of the thicket [i.e., people of Madyan]. Those are the companies.[1323]
translations.english_hilali_khan: And Thamûd, and the people of Lût (Lot), and the Dwellers of the Wood: such were the Confederates.
translations.english_rwwad: and Thamūd and the people of Lot, and the dwellers of the Forest – such were the [denier] parties.

arabic_text: إِن كُلٌّ إِلَّا كَذَّبَ ٱلرُّسُلَ فَحَقَّ عِقَابِ
phonetic: 38.14 'In Kullun 'Illā Kadhaba Ar-Rusula Faĥaqqa `Iqābi

translations.english_saheeh: Each of them denied the messengers, so My penalty was justified.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Not one of them but belied the Messengers; therefore My Torment was justified,
translations.english_rwwad: Each of them rejected their messenger, therefore My punishment became inevitable.

arabic_text: وَمَا يَنظُرُ هَٰٓؤُلَآءِ إِلَّا صَيۡحَةٗ وَٰحِدَةٗ مَّا لَهَا مِن فَوَاقٖ
phonetic: 38.15 Wa Mā Yanžuru Hā'uulā' 'Illā Şayĥatan Wāĥidatan Mā Lahā Min Fawāqin

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1324]- Or "respite."  More literally, "a period between two milkings of a she-camel," which also alludes to the meanings of "return" or "repetition."

translations.english_saheeh: And these [disbelievers] await not but one blast [of the Horn]; for it there will be no delay.[1324]
translations.english_hilali_khan: And these only wait for a single Saihah [shout (i.e. the blowing of the Trumpet by the angel Isrâfil -)] there will be no pause or ending thereto [till everything will perish except Allâh (the only God full of Majesty, Bounty and Honour)].
translations.english_rwwad: They are only waiting for a single Blast that cannot be stopped.

arabic_text: وَقَالُواْ رَبَّنَا عَجِّل لَّنَا قِطَّنَا قَبۡلَ يَوۡمِ ٱلۡحِسَابِ
phonetic: 38.16 Wa Qālū Rabbanā `Ajjil Lanā Qiţţanā Qabla Yawmi Al-Ĥisābi

translations.english_saheeh: And they say, "Our Lord, hasten for us our share [of the punishment] before the Day of Account."
translations.english_hilali_khan: They say: "Our Lord! Hasten to us Qittanâ (i.e. our Record of good and bad deeds so that we may see it) before the Day of Reckoning!"
translations.english_rwwad: They say, “Our Lord, hasten for us our share [of punishment] before the Day of Reckoning.”

arabic_text: ٱصۡبِرۡ عَلَىٰ مَا يَقُولُونَ وَٱذۡكُرۡ عَبۡدَنَا دَاوُۥدَ ذَا ٱلۡأَيۡدِۖ إِنَّهُۥٓ أَوَّابٌ
phonetic: 38.17 Aşbir `Alá Mā Yaqūlūna Wa Adhkur `Abdanā Dāwūda Dhā Al-'Aydi 'Innahu 'Awwābun

translations.english_saheeh: Be patient over what they say and remember Our servant, David, the possessor of strength; indeed, he was one who repeatedly turned back [to Allāh].
translations.english_hilali_khan: Be patient (O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) of what they say, and remember Our slave Dâwûd (David), endued with power. Verily, he was ever oft-returning in all matters and in repentance (toward Allâh).
translations.english_rwwad: Bear with patience whatever they say, and remember Our slave David, the man of strength who constantly turned [to Allah].

arabic_text: إِنَّا سَخَّرۡنَا ٱلۡجِبَالَ مَعَهُۥ يُسَبِّحۡنَ بِٱلۡعَشِيِّ وَٱلۡإِشۡرَاقِ
phonetic: 38.18 'Innā Sakhkharnā Al-Jibāla Ma`ahu Yusabbiĥna Bil-`Ashīyi Wa Al-'Ishrāqi

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed, We subjected the mountains [to praise] with him, exalting [Allāh] in the [late] afternoon and [after] sunrise.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Verily, We made the mountains to glorify Our Praises with him [Dâwûd (David)] in the ‘Ashî (i.e. after the mid-day till sunset) and Ishrâq (i.e. after the sunrise till mid-day).
translations.english_rwwad: We subjected the mountains to join him in glorifying Allah in the evening and the morning,

arabic_text: وَٱلطَّيۡرَ مَحۡشُورَةٗۖ كُلّٞ لَّهُۥٓ أَوَّابٞ
phonetic: 38.19 Wa Aţ-Ţayra Maĥshūratan Kullun Lahu 'Awwābun

translations.english_saheeh: And the birds were assembled, all with him repeating [praises].
translations.english_hilali_khan: And (so did) the birds assembled: all obedient to him [Dâwûd (David)] [i.e. they came and glorified Allâh’s Praises along with him]. (Tafsir Al-Qurtubi ).
translations.english_rwwad: and the birds, in their flocks; they all would echo his praise.

arabic_text: وَشَدَدۡنَا مُلۡكَهُۥ وَءَاتَيۡنَٰهُ ٱلۡحِكۡمَةَ وَفَصۡلَ ٱلۡخِطَابِ
phonetic: 38.20 Wa Shadadnā Mulkahu Wa 'Ātaynāhu Al-Ĥikmata Wa Faşla Al-Khiţābi

translations.english_saheeh: And We strengthened his kingdom and gave him wisdom and discernment in speech.
translations.english_hilali_khan: We made his kingdom strong and gave him Al-Hikmah (Prophethood) and sound judgement in speech and decision.
translations.english_rwwad: We strengthened his kingdom, and gave him wisdom and sound judgment [and speech].

arabic_text: ۞ وَهَلۡ أَتَىٰكَ نَبَؤُاْ ٱلۡخَصۡمِ إِذۡ تَسَوَّرُواْ ٱلۡمِحۡرَابَ
phonetic: 38.21 Wa Hal 'Atāka Naba'u Al-Khaşmi 'Idh Tasawwarū Al-Miĥrāba

translations.english_saheeh: And has there come to you the news of the adversaries, when they climbed over the wall of [his] prayer chamber -
translations.english_hilali_khan: And has the news of the litigants reached you? When they climbed over the wall into (his) Mihrâb (a praying place or a private room);
translations.english_rwwad: Has there come to you the story of the adversaries, when they climbed the wall of his chamber?

arabic_text: إِذۡ دَخَلُواْ عَلَىٰ دَاوُۥدَ فَفَزِعَ مِنۡهُمۡۖ قَالُواْ لَا تَخَفۡۖ خَصۡمَانِ بَغَىٰ بَعۡضُنَا عَلَىٰ بَعۡضٖ فَٱحۡكُم بَيۡنَنَا بِٱلۡحَقِّ وَلَا تُشۡطِطۡ وَٱهۡدِنَآ إِلَىٰ سَوَآءِ ٱلصِّرَٰطِ
phonetic: 38.22 'Idh Dakhalū `Alá Dāwūda Fafazi`a Minhum Qālū Lā Takhaf Khaşmāni Baghá Ba`đunā `Alá Ba`đin Fāĥkum Baynanā Bil-Ĥaqqi Wa Lā Tushţiţ Wa Ahdinā 'Ilá Sawā'i Aş-Şirāţi

translations.english_saheeh: When they entered upon David and he was alarmed by them? They said, "Fear not. [We are] two adversaries, one of whom has wronged the other, so judge between us with truth and do not exceed [it] and guide us to the sound path.
translations.english_hilali_khan: When they entered in upon Dâwûd (David), he was terrified of them. They said: "Fear not! (We are) two litigants, one of whom has wronged the other, therefore judge between us with truth, and treat us not with injustice, and guide us to the Right Way.
translations.english_rwwad: When they entered upon David, he was frightened. They said, “Do not be afraid. We are two adversaries: one of us has wronged the other, so judge between us with fairness, and do not be unjust, and guide us to the straight path.

arabic_text: إِنَّ هَٰذَآ أَخِي لَهُۥ تِسۡعٞ وَتِسۡعُونَ نَعۡجَةٗ وَلِيَ نَعۡجَةٞ وَٰحِدَةٞ فَقَالَ أَكۡفِلۡنِيهَا وَعَزَّنِي فِي ٱلۡخِطَابِ
phonetic: 38.23 'Inna Hādhā 'Akhī Lahu Tis`un Wa Tis`ūna Na`jatan Wa Liya Na`jatun Wāĥidatun Faqāla 'Akfilnīhā Wa `Azzanī Fī Al-Khiţābi

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed this, my brother, has ninety-nine ewes, and I have one ewe; so he said, 'Entrust her to me,' and he overpowered me in speech."
translations.english_hilali_khan: Verily, this my brother (in religion) has ninety-nine ewes, while I have (only) one ewe, and he says: "Hand it over to me, and he overpowered me in speech."
translations.english_rwwad: This is my brother. He has ninety-nine ewes while I have only one. He said, ‘Give her into my charge,’ and he overpowered me in speech.”

arabic_text: قَالَ لَقَدۡ ظَلَمَكَ بِسُؤَالِ نَعۡجَتِكَ إِلَىٰ نِعَاجِهِۦۖ وَإِنَّ كَثِيرٗا مِّنَ ٱلۡخُلَطَآءِ لَيَبۡغِي بَعۡضُهُمۡ عَلَىٰ بَعۡضٍ إِلَّا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُواْ وَعَمِلُواْ ٱلصَّٰلِحَٰتِ وَقَلِيلٞ مَّا هُمۡۗ وَظَنَّ دَاوُۥدُ أَنَّمَا فَتَنَّٰهُ فَٱسۡتَغۡفَرَ رَبَّهُۥ وَخَرَّۤ رَاكِعٗاۤ وَأَنَابَ۩
phonetic: 38.24 Qāla Laqad Žalamaka Bisu'uāli Na`jatika 'Ilá Ni`ājihi Wa 'Inna Kathīrāan Mina Al-Khulaţā'i Layabghī Ba`đuhum `Alá Ba`đin 'Illā Al-Ladhīna 'Āmanū Wa `Amilū Aş-Şāliĥāti Wa Qalīlun Mā Hum Wa Žanna Dāwūdu 'Annamā Fatannāhu Fāstaghfara Rabbahu Wa Kharra Rāki`āan Wa 'Anāba

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1325]- For his errors, such as fear and suspicion of the two men at the outset, any mistake in judgement he might have made, concealed feelings of partiality, etc.

translations.english_saheeh: [David] said, "He has certainly wronged you in demanding your ewe [in addition] to his ewes. And indeed, many associates oppress one another, except for those who believe and do righteous deeds - and few are they." And David became certain that We had tried him, and he asked forgiveness of his Lord[1325] and fell down bowing [in prostration] and turned in repentance [to Allāh].
translations.english_hilali_khan: [Dâwûd (David)] said (immediately without listening to the opponent): "He has wronged you in demanding your ewe in addition to his ewes. And, verily, many partners oppress one another, except those who believe and do righteous good deeds, and they are few." And Dâwûd (David) guessed that We have tried him and he sought Forgiveness of his Lord, and he fell down prostrate and turned (to Allâh) in repentance.
translations.english_rwwad: David said, “He has certainly wronged you by demanding that your ewe be added to his flock. Indeed, many partners oppress one another, except those who believe and do righteous deeds – and how few they are.” Then David realized that We were only testing him, so he asked his Lord for forgiveness, fell down bowing, and turned to Him in repentance.

arabic_text: فَغَفَرۡنَا لَهُۥ ذَٰلِكَۖ وَإِنَّ لَهُۥ عِندَنَا لَزُلۡفَىٰ وَحُسۡنَ مَـَٔابٖ
phonetic: 38.25 Faghafarnā Lahu Dhālika Wa 'Inna Lahu `Indanā Lazulfá Wa Ĥusna Ma'ābin

translations.english_saheeh: So We forgave him that; and indeed, for him is nearness to Us and a good place of return.
translations.english_hilali_khan: So We forgave him that, and verily, for him is a near access to Us, and a good place of (final) return (Paradise).
translations.english_rwwad: So We forgave that for him, and he certainly has a place of nearness to Us and a good place of return.

arabic_text: يَٰدَاوُۥدُ إِنَّا جَعَلۡنَٰكَ خَلِيفَةٗ فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِ فَٱحۡكُم بَيۡنَ ٱلنَّاسِ بِٱلۡحَقِّ وَلَا تَتَّبِعِ ٱلۡهَوَىٰ فَيُضِلَّكَ عَن سَبِيلِ ٱللَّهِۚ إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ يَضِلُّونَ عَن سَبِيلِ ٱللَّهِ لَهُمۡ عَذَابٞ شَدِيدُۢ بِمَا نَسُواْ يَوۡمَ ٱلۡحِسَابِ
phonetic: 38.26 Yā Dāwūdu 'Innā Ja`alnāka Khalīfatan Fī Al-'Arđi Fāĥkum Bayna An-Nāsi Bil-Ĥaqqi Wa Lā Tattabi`i Al-Hawá Fayuđillaka `An Sabīli Allāhi 'Inna Al-Ladhīna Yađillūna `An Sabīli Allāhi Lahum `Adhābun Shadīdun Bimā Nasū Yawma Al-Ĥisābi

translations.english_saheeh: [We said], "O David, indeed We have made you a successor upon the earth, so judge between the people in truth and do not follow [your own] desire, as it will lead you astray from the way of Allāh." Indeed, those who go astray from the way of Allāh will have a severe punishment for having forgotten the Day of Account.
translations.english_hilali_khan: O Dâwûd (David)! Verily! We have placed you as a successor on the earth; so judge you between men in truth (and justice) and follow not your desire - for it will mislead you from the Path of Allâh. Verily, those who wander astray from the Path of Allâh (shall) have a severe torment, because they forgot the Day of Reckoning.
translations.english_rwwad: “O David, We have made you a ruler on earth, so judge between people with justice, and do not follow your desires lest they lead you astray from Allah’s way. Those who go astray from Allah’s way will have a severe punishment because of their forgetting the Day of Reckoning.”

arabic_text: وَمَا خَلَقۡنَا ٱلسَّمَآءَ وَٱلۡأَرۡضَ وَمَا بَيۡنَهُمَا بَٰطِلٗاۚ ذَٰلِكَ ظَنُّ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْۚ فَوَيۡلٞ لِّلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْ مِنَ ٱلنَّارِ
phonetic: 38.27 Wa Mā Khalaqnā As-Samā'a Wa Al-'Arđa Wa Mā Baynahumā Bāţilāan Dhālika Žannu Al-Ladhīna Kafarū Fawaylun Lilladhīna Kafarū Mina An-Nāri

translations.english_saheeh: And We did not create the heaven and the earth and that between them aimlessly. That is the assumption of those who disbelieve, so woe to those who disbelieve from the Fire.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And We created not the heaven and the earth and all that is between them without purpose! That is the consideration of those who disbelieve! Then woe to those who disbelieve (in Islâmic Monotheism) from the Fire!
translations.english_rwwad: We have not created the heavens and earth and all that is between them in vain. That is the assumption of those who disbelieve. So woe to the disbelievers from the Fire!

arabic_text: أَمۡ نَجۡعَلُ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُواْ وَعَمِلُواْ ٱلصَّٰلِحَٰتِ كَٱلۡمُفۡسِدِينَ فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِ أَمۡ نَجۡعَلُ ٱلۡمُتَّقِينَ كَٱلۡفُجَّارِ
phonetic: 38.28 'Am Naj`alu Al-Ladhīna 'Āmanū Wa `Amilū Aş-Şāliĥāti Kālmufsidīna Fī Al-'Arđi 'Am Naj`alu Al-Muttaqīna Kālfujjāri

translations.english_saheeh: Or should We treat those who believe and do righteous deeds like corrupters in the land? Or should We treat those who fear Allāh like the wicked?
translations.english_hilali_khan: as the Fujjâr (criminals, disbelievers, the wicked)?
translations.english_rwwad: Should We make those who believe and do righteous deeds equal to those who spread corruption on earth? Or should We make the righteous equal to the wicked?

arabic_text: كِتَٰبٌ أَنزَلۡنَٰهُ إِلَيۡكَ مُبَٰرَكٞ لِّيَدَّبَّرُوٓاْ ءَايَٰتِهِۦ وَلِيَتَذَكَّرَ أُوْلُواْ ٱلۡأَلۡبَٰبِ
phonetic: 38.29 Kitābun 'Anzalnāhu 'Ilayka Mubārakun Liyaddabbarū 'Āyātihi Wa Liyatadhakkara 'Ūlū Al-'Albābi

translations.english_saheeh: [This is] a blessed Book which We have revealed to you, [O Muḥammad], that they might reflect upon its verses and that those of understanding would be reminded.
translations.english_hilali_khan: (This is) a Book (the Qur’ân) which We have sent down to you, full of blessings, that they may ponder over its Verses, and that men of understanding may remember.
translations.english_rwwad: This is a blessed Book that We have sent down to you [O Prophet] so that they may reflect upon its verses, and so that people of understanding may take heed.

arabic_text: وَوَهَبۡنَا لِدَاوُۥدَ سُلَيۡمَٰنَۚ نِعۡمَ ٱلۡعَبۡدُ إِنَّهُۥٓ أَوَّابٌ
phonetic: 38.30 Wa Wahabnā Lidāwūda Sulaymāna Ni`ma Al-`Abdu 'Innahu 'Awwābun

translations.english_saheeh: And to David We gave Solomon. An excellent servant, indeed he was one repeatedly turning back [to Allāh].
translations.english_hilali_khan: And to Dâwûd (David) We gave Sulaimân (Solomon). How excellent a slave! Verily, he was ever oft-returning in repentance (to Us)!
translations.english_rwwad: We gave David Solomon, an excellent and faithful slave who constantly turned [to Us].

arabic_text: إِذۡ عُرِضَ عَلَيۡهِ بِٱلۡعَشِيِّ ٱلصَّٰفِنَٰتُ ٱلۡجِيَادُ
phonetic: 38.31 'Idh `Uriđa `Alayhi Bil-`Ashīyi Aş-Şāfinātu Al-Jiyādu

translations.english_saheeh: [Mention] when there were exhibited before him in the afternoon the poised [standing] racehorses.
translations.english_hilali_khan: When there were displayed before him, in the afternoon, well trained horses of the highest breed [for Jihâd (holy fighting in Allâh’s Cause)].
translations.english_rwwad: One evening, well-trained and swift horses of noble breed were presented before him.

arabic_text: فَقَالَ إِنِّيٓ أَحۡبَبۡتُ حُبَّ ٱلۡخَيۡرِ عَن ذِكۡرِ رَبِّي حَتَّىٰ تَوَارَتۡ بِٱلۡحِجَابِ
phonetic: 38.32 Faqāla 'Innī 'Aĥbabtu Ĥubba Al-Khayri `An Dhikri Rabbī Ĥattá Tawārat Bil-Ĥijābi

translations.english_saheeh: And he said, "Indeed, I gave preference to the love of good [things] over the remembrance of my Lord until it [i.e., the sun] disappeared into the curtain [of darkness]."
translations.english_hilali_khan: He said: "I did love the good (these horses) instead of remembering my Lord (in my ‘Asr prayer)" till the time was over, and (the sun) had hidden in the veil (of night).
translations.english_rwwad: He then said, “I gave preference to the love of fine things over the remembrance of my Lord,” until the sun went out of sight.

arabic_text: رُدُّوهَا عَلَيَّۖ فَطَفِقَ مَسۡحَۢا بِٱلسُّوقِ وَٱلۡأَعۡنَاقِ
phonetic: 38.33 Ruddūhā `Alayya Faţafiqa Masĥāan Bis-Sūqi Wa Al-'A`nāqi

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1326]- With his sword as expiation.  Some commentaries have also suggested the meaning of "stroking" with the hand.

translations.english_saheeh: [He said], "Return them to me," and set about striking[1326] [their] legs and necks.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then he said "Bring them (horses) back to me." Then he began to pass his hand over their legs and their necks (till the end of the display).
translations.english_rwwad: [He ordered], “Bring them back to me,” and he began striking [their] shanks and necks.

arabic_text: وَلَقَدۡ فَتَنَّا سُلَيۡمَٰنَ وَأَلۡقَيۡنَا عَلَىٰ كُرۡسِيِّهِۦ جَسَدٗا ثُمَّ أَنَابَ
phonetic: 38.34 Wa Laqad Fatannā Sulaymāna Wa 'Alqaynā `Alá Kursīyihi Jasadāan Thumma 'Anāba

footnotes.english_saheeh:
[1327]- Said to be a devil or a lifeless body (one without capability), but Allāh alone knows.
[1328]- To sovereignty and to Allāh in repentance.

translations.english_saheeh: And We certainly tried Solomon and placed on his throne a body;[1327] then he returned.[1328]
translations.english_hilali_khan: And indeed, We did try Sulaimân (Solomon) and We placed on his throne Jasad (a devil, so he lost his kingdom for a while) and he did return (to Allâh with obedience and in repentance, and to his throne and kingdom by the Grace of Allâh).
translations.english_rwwad: Indeed, We tested Solomon and cast upon his throne a body, then he turned [to Allah].

arabic_text: قَالَ رَبِّ ٱغۡفِرۡ لِي وَهَبۡ لِي مُلۡكٗا لَّا يَنۢبَغِي لِأَحَدٖ مِّنۢ بَعۡدِيٓۖ إِنَّكَ أَنتَ ٱلۡوَهَّابُ
phonetic: 38.35 Qāla Rabbi Aghfir Lī Wa Hab Lī Mulkāan Lā Yanbaghī Li'ĥadin Min Ba`dī 'Innaka 'Anta Al-Wahhābu

translations.english_saheeh: He said, "My Lord, forgive me and grant me a kingdom such as will not belong to anyone after me. Indeed, You are the Bestower."
translations.english_hilali_khan: He said: "My Lord! Forgive me, and bestow upon me a kingdom such as shall not belong to any other after me: Verily, You are the Bestower."
translations.english_rwwad: He said, “My Lord, forgive me and grant me a kingdom, the like of which will never be granted to anyone after me. You are indeed the Bestower.”

arabic_text: فَسَخَّرۡنَا لَهُ ٱلرِّيحَ تَجۡرِي بِأَمۡرِهِۦ رُخَآءً حَيۡثُ أَصَابَ
phonetic: 38.36 Fasakhkharnā Lahu Ar-Rīĥa Tajrī Bi'amrihi Rukhā'an Ĥaythu 'Aşāba

translations.english_saheeh: So We subjected to him the wind blowing by his command, gently, wherever he directed,
translations.english_hilali_khan: So, We subjected to him the wind; it blew gently by his order whithersoever he willed,
translations.english_rwwad: So We subjected to him the wind blowing gently by his command to wherever he wished,

arabic_text: وَٱلشَّيَٰطِينَ كُلَّ بَنَّآءٖ وَغَوَّاصٖ
phonetic: 38.37 Wa Ash-Shayāţīna Kulla Bannā'in Wa Ghawwāşin

translations.english_saheeh: And [also] the devils [of jinn] - every builder and diver.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And also the Shayâtîn (devils) from the jinn (including) every kind of builder and diver,
translations.english_rwwad: And [We subjected to him] the devils, all kinds of builders and divers,

arabic_text: وَءَاخَرِينَ مُقَرَّنِينَ فِي ٱلۡأَصۡفَادِ
phonetic: 38.38 Wa 'Ākharīna Muqarranīna Fī Al-'Aşfādi

translations.english_saheeh: And others bound together in irons.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And also others bound in fetters.
translations.english_rwwad: and others bound in chains.

arabic_text: هَٰذَا عَطَآؤُنَا فَٱمۡنُنۡ أَوۡ أَمۡسِكۡ بِغَيۡرِ حِسَابٖ
phonetic: 38.39 Hādhā `Aţā'uunā Fāmnun 'Aw 'Amsik Bighayri Ĥisābin

translations.english_saheeh: [We said], "This is Our gift, so grant or withhold without account."
translations.english_hilali_khan: [Allâh said to Sulaimân (Solomon)]: "This is Our gift: so spend you or withhold, no account will be asked (of you)."
translations.english_rwwad: [We said], “This is Our gift, so give freely or withhold, without account.”

arabic_text: وَإِنَّ لَهُۥ عِندَنَا لَزُلۡفَىٰ وَحُسۡنَ مَـَٔابٖ
phonetic: 38.40 Wa 'Inna Lahu `Indanā Lazulfá Wa Ĥusna Ma'ābin

translations.english_saheeh: And indeed, for him is nearness to Us and a good place of return.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And verily, for him is a near access to Us, and a good (final) return (Paradise).
translations.english_rwwad: And he certainly has a status of nearness to Us and a good place of return.

arabic_text: وَٱذۡكُرۡ عَبۡدَنَآ أَيُّوبَ إِذۡ نَادَىٰ رَبَّهُۥٓ أَنِّي مَسَّنِيَ ٱلشَّيۡطَٰنُ بِنُصۡبٖ وَعَذَابٍ
phonetic: 38.41 Wa Adhkur `Abdanā 'Ayyūba 'Idh Nādá Rabbahu 'Annī Massanī Ash-Shayţānu Binuşbin Wa `Adhābin

translations.english_saheeh: And remember Our servant Job, when he called to his Lord, "Indeed, Satan has touched me with hardship and torment."
translations.english_hilali_khan: And remember Our slave Ayyûb (Job), when he invoked his Lord (saying): "Verily Shaitân (Satan) has touched me with distress (by ruining my health) and torment (by ruining my wealth)!
translations.english_rwwad: And remember Our slave Job, when he cried out to his Lord, “Indeed, Satan has afflicted me with hardship and pain.”

arabic_text: ٱرۡكُضۡ بِرِجۡلِكَۖ هَٰذَا مُغۡتَسَلُۢ بَارِدٞ وَشَرَابٞ
phonetic: 38.42 Arkuđ Birijlika Hādhā Mughtasalun Bāridun Wa Sharābun

translations.english_saheeh: [So he was told], "Strike [the ground] with your foot; this is a [spring for a] cool bath and drink."
translations.english_hilali_khan: (Allâh said to him): "Strike the ground with your foot: This is (a spring of) water to wash in, cool and a (refreshing) drink."
translations.english_rwwad: [Allah said], “Stamp [the ground] with your foot: here is a cool spring for bathing and drinking.”

arabic_text: وَوَهَبۡنَا لَهُۥٓ أَهۡلَهُۥ وَمِثۡلَهُم مَّعَهُمۡ رَحۡمَةٗ مِّنَّا وَذِكۡرَىٰ لِأُوْلِي ٱلۡأَلۡبَٰبِ
phonetic: 38.43 Wa Wahabnā Lahu 'Ahlahu Wa Mithlahum Ma`ahum Raĥmatan Minnā Wa Dhikrá Li'wlī Al-'Albābi

translations.english_saheeh: And We granted him his family and a like [number] with them as mercy from Us and a reminder for those of understanding.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And We gave him (back) his family, and along with them the like thereof, as a Mercy from Us, and a Reminder for those who understand.
translations.english_rwwad: And We restored his family to him and the like of them as a mercy from Us and as a reminder for people of understanding.

arabic_text: وَخُذۡ بِيَدِكَ ضِغۡثٗا فَٱضۡرِب بِّهِۦ وَلَا تَحۡنَثۡۗ إِنَّا وَجَدۡنَٰهُ صَابِرٗاۚ نِّعۡمَ ٱلۡعَبۡدُ إِنَّهُۥٓ أَوَّابٞ
phonetic: 38.44 Wa Khudh Biyadika Đighthāan Fāđrib Bihi Wa Lā Taĥnath 'Innā Wa Jadnāhu Şābirāan Ni`ma Al-`Abdu 'Innahu 'Awwābun

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1329]- At a point during his illness, Job became angry with his wife and swore that if he recovered, he would punish her with one hundred lashes.  According to Allāh's instruction, the oath was fulfilled by striking her once with one hundred blades of grass.
footnotes.english_hilali_khan: (V.38:44) During the ailment of Ayyûb (Job), his wife used to beg for him, and Satan told her a word of disbelief to say and she told her husband [Ayyûb (Job)]; so he became angry with her and took an oath to strike her one hundred lashes. So Allah ordered Ayyûb (Job) to fulfil his oath by striking her with the bundle of thin grass. (Tafsîr Al-Qurtubi,).

translations.english_saheeh: [We said], "And take in your hand a bunch [of grass] and strike with it and do not break your oath."[1329] Indeed, We found him patient, an excellent servant. Indeed, he was one repeatedly turning back [to Allāh].
translations.english_hilali_khan: "And take in your hand a bundle of thin grass and strike therewith (your wife), and break not your oath.[1] Truly! We found him patient. How excellent a slave! Verily he was ever oft-returning in repentance (to Us)!
translations.english_rwwad: [We said], “Take a bunch of grass in your hand, and strike [your wife] with it, and do not break your oath.” We truly found him patient – an excellent and faithful slave he was. He constantly turned [to Us].

arabic_text: وَٱذۡكُرۡ عِبَٰدَنَآ إِبۡرَٰهِيمَ وَإِسۡحَٰقَ وَيَعۡقُوبَ أُوْلِي ٱلۡأَيۡدِي وَٱلۡأَبۡصَٰرِ
phonetic: 38.45 Wa Adhkur `Ibādanā 'Ibrāhīma Wa 'Isĥāqa Wa Ya`qūba 'Ūlī Al-'Aydī Wa Al-'Abşāri

translations.english_saheeh: And remember Our servants, Abraham, Isaac and Jacob - those of strength and [religious] vision.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And remember Our slaves, Ibrâhîm (Abraham), Ishâq (Isaac), and Ya‘qûb (Jacob), (all) owners of strength (in worshipping Us) and (also) of religious understanding.
translations.english_rwwad: Remember Our slaves: Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob – men of strength and insight.

arabic_text: إِنَّآ أَخۡلَصۡنَٰهُم بِخَالِصَةٖ ذِكۡرَى ٱلدَّارِ
phonetic: 38.46 'Innā 'Akhlaşnāhum Bikhālişatin Dhikrá Ad-Dāri

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed, We chose them for an exclusive quality: remembrance of the home [of the Hereafter].
translations.english_hilali_khan: Verily, We did choose them by granting them (a good thing, - i.e.) the remembrance of the Home [in the Hereafter and they used to make the people remember it, and also they used to invite the people to obey Allâh and to do good deeds for the Hereafter].
translations.english_rwwad: We chose them exclusively for the remembrance of the Final Home.

arabic_text: وَإِنَّهُمۡ عِندَنَا لَمِنَ ٱلۡمُصۡطَفَيۡنَ ٱلۡأَخۡيَارِ
phonetic: 38.47 Wa 'Innahum `Indanā Lamina Al-Muşţafayna Al-'Akhyāri

translations.english_saheeh: And indeed they are, to Us, among the chosen and outstanding.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And they are with Us, verily, of the chosen and the best!
translations.english_rwwad: Indeed, they are before us among the chosen and best ones.

arabic_text: وَٱذۡكُرۡ إِسۡمَٰعِيلَ وَٱلۡيَسَعَ وَذَا ٱلۡكِفۡلِۖ وَكُلّٞ مِّنَ ٱلۡأَخۡيَارِ
phonetic: 38.48 Wa Adhkur 'Ismā`īla Wa Al-Yasa`a Wa Dhā Al-Kifli Wa Kullun Mina Al-'Akhyāri

translations.english_saheeh: And remember Ishmael, Elisha and Dhul-Kifl, and all are among the outstanding.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And remember Ismâ‘îl (Ishmael), Alyasa‘ (Elisha), and Dhul-Kifl (Isaiah), all are among the best.
translations.english_rwwad: Also remember Ishmael, Elisha, and Dhul-Kifl – all were among the best.

arabic_text: هَٰذَا ذِكۡرٞۚ وَإِنَّ لِلۡمُتَّقِينَ لَحُسۡنَ مَـَٔابٖ
phonetic: 38.49 Hādhā Dhikrun Wa 'Inna Lilmuttaqīna Laĥusna Ma'ābin

translations.english_saheeh: This is a reminder. And indeed, for the righteous is a good place of return -
translations.english_hilali_khan: is a good final return (Paradise),
translations.english_rwwad: This is a reminder. And the righteous will surely have a good return:

arabic_text: جَنَّٰتِ عَدۡنٖ مُّفَتَّحَةٗ لَّهُمُ ٱلۡأَبۡوَٰبُ
phonetic: 38.50 Jannāti `Adnin Mufattaĥatan Lahumu Al-'Abwābu

translations.english_saheeh: Gardens of perpetual residence, whose doors will be opened to them.
translations.english_hilali_khan: ‘Adn (Eden) Paradise (everlasting Gardens), whose doors will be opened for them.
translations.english_rwwad: Gardens of Eternity, with gates wide open for them.

arabic_text: مُتَّكِـِٔينَ فِيهَا يَدۡعُونَ فِيهَا بِفَٰكِهَةٖ كَثِيرَةٖ وَشَرَابٖ
phonetic: 38.51 Muttaki'īna Fīhā Yad`ūna Fīhā Bifākihatin Kathīratin Wa Sharābin

translations.english_saheeh: Reclining within them, they will call therein for abundant fruit and drink.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Therein they will recline; therein they will call for fruits in abundance and drinks;
translations.english_rwwad: They will recline therein, calling for abundant fruit and drink.

arabic_text: ۞ وَعِندَهُمۡ قَٰصِرَٰتُ ٱلطَّرۡفِ أَتۡرَابٌ
phonetic: 38.52 Wa `Indahum Qāşirātu Aţ-Ţarfi 'Atrābun

translations.english_saheeh: And with them will be women limiting [their] glances[1330] and of equal age.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And beside them will be Qâsirât-at-Tarf [chaste females (wives) restraining their glances (desiring none except their husbands)], (and) of equal ages.
translations.english_rwwad: And they will have maidens of modest gaze and equal age.

arabic_text: هَٰذَا مَا تُوعَدُونَ لِيَوۡمِ ٱلۡحِسَابِ
phonetic: 38.53 Hādhā Mā Tū`adūna Liyawmi Al-Ĥisābi

translations.english_saheeh: This is what you, [the righteous], are promised for the Day of Account.
translations.english_hilali_khan: are promised for the Day of Reckoning!
translations.english_rwwad: This is what you are promised for the Day of Account.

arabic_text: إِنَّ هَٰذَا لَرِزۡقُنَا مَا لَهُۥ مِن نَّفَادٍ
phonetic: 38.54 'Inna Hādhā Larizqunā Mā Lahu Min Nafādin

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed, this is Our provision; for it there is no depletion.
translations.english_hilali_khan: (It will be said to them)! Verily, this is Our Provision which will never finish.
translations.english_rwwad: Indeed, this is Our provision [for the righteous] that will never cease.

arabic_text: هَٰذَاۚ وَإِنَّ لِلطَّٰغِينَ لَشَرَّ مَـَٔابٖ
phonetic: 38.55 Hādhā Wa 'Inna Lilţţāghīna Lasharra Ma'ābin

translations.english_saheeh: This [is so]. But indeed, for the transgressors is an evil place of return -
translations.english_hilali_khan: This is so! And for the Tâghûn (transgressors, the disobedient to Allâh and His Messenger - disbelievers in the Oneness of Allâh, criminals) will be an evil final return (Fire).
translations.english_rwwad: This [is so]. But the transgressors will surely have a worst return:

arabic_text: جَهَنَّمَ يَصۡلَوۡنَهَا فَبِئۡسَ ٱلۡمِهَادُ
phonetic: 38.56 Jahannama Yaşlawnahā Fabi'sa Al-Mihādu

translations.english_saheeh: Hell, which they will [enter to] burn, and wretched is the resting place.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Hell! Where they will burn, and worst (indeed) is that place to rest!
translations.english_rwwad: Hell, where they will burn. What a terrible resting place!

arabic_text: هَٰذَا فَلۡيَذُوقُوهُ حَمِيمٞ وَغَسَّاقٞ
phonetic: 38.57 Hādhā Falyadhūqūhu Ĥamīmun Wa Ghassāqun

translations.english_saheeh: This - so let them taste it - is scalding water and [foul] purulence.
translations.english_hilali_khan: This is so! Then let them taste it - a boiling fluid and dirty wound discharges.
translations.english_rwwad: Let them taste this: scalding water and pus,

arabic_text: وَءَاخَرُ مِن شَكۡلِهِۦٓ أَزۡوَٰجٌ
phonetic: 38.58 Wa 'Ākharu Min Shaklihi 'Azwājun

translations.english_saheeh: And other [punishments] of its type [in various] kinds.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And other (torments) of similar kind - all together!
translations.english_rwwad: and other similar [torments] of various kinds.

arabic_text: هَٰذَا فَوۡجٞ مُّقۡتَحِمٞ مَّعَكُمۡ لَا مَرۡحَبَۢا بِهِمۡۚ إِنَّهُمۡ صَالُواْ ٱلنَّارِ
phonetic: 38.59 Hādhā Fawjun Muqtaĥimun Ma`akum Lā Marĥabāan Bihim 'Innahum Şālū An-Nāri

translations.english_saheeh: [Its inhabitants will say], "This is a company bursting in with you. No welcome for them. Indeed, they will burn in the Fire."
translations.english_hilali_khan: This is a troop entering with you (in Hell), no welcome for them! Verily, they shall burn in the Fire!
translations.english_rwwad: [The misleaders will say], “Here is a crowd of people being thrown in with you. There is no welcome for them; they will surely burn in the Fire.”

arabic_text: قَالُواْ بَلۡ أَنتُمۡ لَا مَرۡحَبَۢا بِكُمۡۖ أَنتُمۡ قَدَّمۡتُمُوهُ لَنَاۖ فَبِئۡسَ ٱلۡقَرَارُ
phonetic: 38.60 Qālū Bal 'Antum Lā Marĥabāan Bikum 'Antum Qaddamtumūhu Lanā Fabi'sa Al-Qarāru

translations.english_saheeh: They will say, "Nor you! No welcome for you. You, [our leaders], brought this upon us, and wretched is the settlement."
translations.english_hilali_khan: (The followers of the misleaders will say): "Nay, you (too)! No welcome for you! It is you (misleaders) who brought this upon us (because you misled us in the world), so evil is this place to stay in!"
translations.english_rwwad: They will say, “No, it is you for whom there is no welcome! You brought this on us. What a terrible place to settle in!”

arabic_text: قَالُواْ رَبَّنَا مَن قَدَّمَ لَنَا هَٰذَا فَزِدۡهُ عَذَابٗا ضِعۡفٗا فِي ٱلنَّارِ
phonetic: 38.61 Qālū Rabbanā Man Qaddama Lanā Hādhā Fazid/hu `Adhābāan Đi`fāan Fī An-Nāri

translations.english_saheeh: They will say, "Our Lord, whoever brought this upon us - increase for him double punishment in the Fire."
translations.english_hilali_khan: They will say: "Our Lord! Whoever brought this upon us, add to him a double torment in the Fire!"
translations.english_rwwad: They will say, “Our Lord, whoever brought this on us, give him double punishment in the Fire.”

arabic_text: وَقَالُواْ مَا لَنَا لَا نَرَىٰ رِجَالٗا كُنَّا نَعُدُّهُم مِّنَ ٱلۡأَشۡرَارِ
phonetic: 38.62 Wa Qālū Mā Lanā Lā Nará Rijālāan Kunnā Na`udduhum Mina Al-'Ashrār

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1331]- They are referring to the believers.

translations.english_saheeh: And they will say, "Why do we not see men whom we used to count among the worst?[1331]
translations.english_hilali_khan: And they will say: "What is the matter with us that we see not men whom we used to count among the bad ones?"
translations.english_rwwad: They will say, “Why do we not see those whom we considered to be among the wicked?

arabic_text: أَتَّخَذۡنَٰهُمۡ سِخۡرِيًّا أَمۡ زَاغَتۡ عَنۡهُمُ ٱلۡأَبۡصَٰرُ
phonetic: 38.63 'Āttakhadhnāhum Sikhrīyāan 'Am Zāghat `Anhumu Al-'Abşāru

translations.english_saheeh: Is it [because] we took them in ridicule, or has [our] vision turned away from them?"
translations.english_hilali_khan: Did we take them as an object of mockery, or have (our) eyes failed to perceive them?"
translations.english_rwwad: Is it that we mistakenly made fun of them, or do our eyes fail to see them [in the Fire]?”

arabic_text: إِنَّ ذَٰلِكَ لَحَقّٞ تَخَاصُمُ أَهۡلِ ٱلنَّارِ
phonetic: 38.64 'Inna Dhālika Laĥaqqun Takhāşumu 'Ahli An-Nāri

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed, that is truth [i.e., reality] - the quarreling of the people of the Fire.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Verily, that is the very truth - the mutual dispute of the people of the Fire!
translations.english_rwwad: This is certainly true that the people of the Fire will dispute among themselves.

arabic_text: قُلۡ إِنَّمَآ أَنَا۠ مُنذِرٞۖ وَمَا مِنۡ إِلَٰهٍ إِلَّا ٱللَّهُ ٱلۡوَٰحِدُ ٱلۡقَهَّارُ
phonetic: 38.65 Qul 'Innamā 'Anā Mundhirun Wa Mā Min 'Ilahin 'Illā Allāhu Al-Wāĥidu Al-Qahhāru

translations.english_saheeh: Say, [O Muḥammad], "I am only a warner, and there is not any deity except Allāh, the One, the Prevailing,[1332]
translations.english_hilali_khan: Say (O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم): "I am only a warner and there is no Ilâh (God) except Allâh (none has the right to be worshipped but Allâh) the One, the Irresistible,
translations.english_rwwad: Say [O Prophet], “I am only a warner, and none has the right to be worshiped except Allah, the One, the Subjugator,

arabic_text: رَبُّ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضِ وَمَا بَيۡنَهُمَا ٱلۡعَزِيزُ ٱلۡغَفَّٰرُ
phonetic: 38.66 Rabbu As-Samāwāti Wa Al-'Arđi Wa Mā Baynahumā Al-`Azīzu Al-Ghaffāru

footnotes.english_saheeh:
[1333]- Honored for absolute power associated with wisdom and justice.
[1334]- Who continually conceals sins and faults.

translations.english_saheeh: Lord of the heavens and the earth and whatever is between them, the Exalted in Might,[1333] the Perpetual Forgiver."[1334]
translations.english_hilali_khan: "The Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them, the All-Mighty, the Oft-Forgiving."
translations.english_rwwad: Lord of the heavens and earth and all that is between them, the All-Mighty, Most Forgiving.”

arabic_text: قُلۡ هُوَ نَبَؤٌاْ عَظِيمٌ
phonetic: 38.67 Qul Huwa Naba'un `Ažīmun

translations.english_saheeh: Say, "It is great news
translations.english_hilali_khan: Say: "That (this Qur’ân) is a great news,
translations.english_rwwad: Say, “This [Qur’an] is of great importance

arabic_text: أَنتُمۡ عَنۡهُ مُعۡرِضُونَ
phonetic: 38.68 'Antum `Anhu Mu`riđūna

translations.english_saheeh: From which you turn away.
translations.english_hilali_khan: "From which you turn away!
translations.english_rwwad: from which you are turning away.”

arabic_text: مَا كَانَ لِيَ مِنۡ عِلۡمِۭ بِٱلۡمَلَإِ ٱلۡأَعۡلَىٰٓ إِذۡ يَخۡتَصِمُونَ
phonetic: 38.69 Mā Kāna Liya Min `Ilmin Bil-Mala'i Al-'A`lá 'Idh Yakhtaşimūna

translations.english_saheeh: I had no knowledge of the exalted assembly [of angels] when they were disputing [the creation of Adam].
translations.english_hilali_khan: "I had no knowledge of the chiefs (angels) on high when they were disputing and discussing (about the creation of Adam).
translations.english_rwwad: [And say], “I had no knowledge of the highest assembly [of angels] when they were disputing [about Adam].

arabic_text: إِن يُوحَىٰٓ إِلَيَّ إِلَّآ أَنَّمَآ أَنَا۠ نَذِيرٞ مُّبِينٌ
phonetic: 38.70 'In Yūĥá 'Ilayya 'Illā 'Annamā 'Anā Nadhīrun Mubīnun

translations.english_saheeh: It has not been revealed to me except that I am a clear warner."
translations.english_hilali_khan: "Only this has been revealed to me, that I am a plain warner."
translations.english_rwwad: I have only received revelation in order to give a clear warning.”

arabic_text: إِذۡ قَالَ رَبُّكَ لِلۡمَلَٰٓئِكَةِ إِنِّي خَٰلِقُۢ بَشَرٗا مِّن طِينٖ
phonetic: 38.71 'Idh Qāla Rabbuka Lilmalā'ikati 'Innī Khāliqun Basharāan Min Ţīnin

translations.english_saheeh: [So mention] when your Lord said to the angels, "Indeed, I am going to create a human being from clay.
translations.english_hilali_khan: (Remember) when your Lord said to the angels: "Truly I am going to create man from clay".
translations.english_rwwad: [Remember] when your Lord said to the angels, “I am going to create a human being from clay.

arabic_text: فَإِذَا سَوَّيۡتُهُۥ وَنَفَخۡتُ فِيهِ مِن رُّوحِي فَقَعُواْ لَهُۥ سَٰجِدِينَ
phonetic: 38.72 Fa'idhā Sawwaytuhu Wa Nafakhtu Fīhi Min Rūĥī Faqa`ū Lahu Sājidīna

translations.english_saheeh: So when I have proportioned him and breathed into him of My [created] soul,[1335] then fall down to him in prostration."
translations.english_hilali_khan: So when I have fashioned him and breathed into him (his) soul created by Me, then you fall down prostrate to him."
translations.english_rwwad: When I completed his creation and breathed into him of My [created] soul, fall down in prostration to him.”

arabic_text: فَسَجَدَ ٱلۡمَلَٰٓئِكَةُ كُلُّهُمۡ أَجۡمَعُونَ
phonetic: 38.73 Fasajada Al-Malā'ikatu Kulluhum 'Ajma`ūna

translations.english_saheeh: So the angels prostrated - all of them entirely,
translations.english_hilali_khan: So the angels prostrated themselves, all of them:
translations.english_rwwad: Then the angels fell down in prostration all together,

arabic_text: إِلَّآ إِبۡلِيسَ ٱسۡتَكۡبَرَ وَكَانَ مِنَ ٱلۡكَٰفِرِينَ
phonetic: 38.74 'Illā 'Iblīsa Astakbara Wa Kāna Mina Al-Kāfirīna

translations.english_saheeh: Except Iblees;[1336] he was arrogant and became among the disbelievers.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Except Iblîs (Satan): he was proud[1] and was one of the disbelievers.
translations.english_rwwad: except Iblīs, who was arrogant and became one of the disbelievers.

arabic_text: قَالَ يَٰٓإِبۡلِيسُ مَا مَنَعَكَ أَن تَسۡجُدَ لِمَا خَلَقۡتُ بِيَدَيَّۖ أَسۡتَكۡبَرۡتَ أَمۡ كُنتَ مِنَ ٱلۡعَالِينَ
phonetic: 38.75 Qāla Yā 'Iblīsu Mā Mana`aka 'An Tasjuda Limā Khalaqtu Biyadayya 'Āstakbarta 'Am Kunta Mina Al-`Ālīna

translations.english_saheeh: [Allāh] said, "O Iblees, what prevented you from prostrating to that which I created with My hands?[1337] Were you arrogant [then], or were you [already] among the haughty?"
translations.english_hilali_khan: (Allâh) said: "O Iblîs (Satan)! What prevents you from prostrating yourself to one whom I have created with Both My Hands[2]. Are you too proud (to fall prostrate to Adam) or are you one of the high exalted?"
translations.english_rwwad: [Allah] said, “O Iblīs, what prevented you from prostrating to whom I created with My two Hands? Did you just became proud or have you always been arrogant?”

arabic_text: قَالَ أَنَا۠ خَيۡرٞ مِّنۡهُ خَلَقۡتَنِي مِن نَّارٖ وَخَلَقۡتَهُۥ مِن طِينٖ
phonetic: 38.76 Qāla 'Anā Khayrun Minhu Khalaqtanī Min Nārin Wa Khalaqtahu Min Ţīnin

translations.english_saheeh: He said, "I am better than him. You created me from fire and created him from clay."
translations.english_hilali_khan: [Iblîs (Satan)] said: "I am better than he. You created me from fire, and You created him from clay."
translations.english_rwwad: He said, “I am better than him: You created me from fire and created him from clay.”

arabic_text: قَالَ فَٱخۡرُجۡ مِنۡهَا فَإِنَّكَ رَجِيمٞ
phonetic: 38.77 Qāla Fākhruj Minhā Fa'innaka Rajīmun

translations.english_saheeh: [Allāh] said, "Then get out of it [i.e., Paradise], for indeed, you are expelled.
translations.english_hilali_khan: (Allâh) said: "Then get out from here; for verily you are outcast.
translations.english_rwwad: [Allah] said, “Then get out of here, for you are accursed,

arabic_text: وَإِنَّ عَلَيۡكَ لَعۡنَتِيٓ إِلَىٰ يَوۡمِ ٱلدِّينِ
phonetic: 38.78 Wa 'Inna `Alayka La`natī 'Ilá Yawmi Ad-Dīni

translations.english_saheeh: And indeed, upon you is My curse until the Day of Recompense."
translations.english_hilali_khan: "And verily My Curse is on you till the Day of Recompense."
translations.english_rwwad: and My curse will be upon you until the Day of Judgment.”

arabic_text: قَالَ رَبِّ فَأَنظِرۡنِيٓ إِلَىٰ يَوۡمِ يُبۡعَثُونَ
phonetic: 38.79 Qāla Rabbi Fa'anžirnī 'Ilá Yawmi Yub`athūna

translations.english_saheeh: He said, "My Lord, then reprieve me until the Day they are resurrected."
translations.english_hilali_khan: [Iblîs (Satan)] said: "My Lord! Give me then respite till the Day the (dead) are resurrected."
translations.english_rwwad: He said, “My Lord, then give me respite until the Day of their resurrection.”

arabic_text: قَالَ فَإِنَّكَ مِنَ ٱلۡمُنظَرِينَ
phonetic: 38.80 Qāla Fa'innaka Mina Al-Munžarīna

translations.english_saheeh: [Allāh] said, "So indeed, you are of those reprieved
translations.english_hilali_khan: (Allâh) said: "Verily! You are of those allowed respite."
translations.english_rwwad: Allah said, “You are given respite,

arabic_text: إِلَىٰ يَوۡمِ ٱلۡوَقۡتِ ٱلۡمَعۡلُومِ
phonetic: 38.81 'Ilá Yawmi Al-Waqti Al-Ma`lūmi

translations.english_saheeh: Until the Day of the time well-known."
translations.english_hilali_khan: "Till the Day of the time appointed."
translations.english_rwwad: until the Day of the appointed time.”

arabic_text: قَالَ فَبِعِزَّتِكَ لَأُغۡوِيَنَّهُمۡ أَجۡمَعِينَ
phonetic: 38.82 Qāla Fabi`izzatika La'ughwiyannahum 'Ajma`īna

translations.english_saheeh: [Iblees] said, "By Your might, I will surely mislead them all.
translations.english_hilali_khan: [Iblîs (Satan)] said: "By Your Might, then I will surely mislead them all,
translations.english_rwwad: Iblīs said, “By Your Might, I will surely mislead them all,

arabic_text: إِلَّا عِبَادَكَ مِنۡهُمُ ٱلۡمُخۡلَصِينَ
phonetic: 38.83 'Illā `Ibādaka Minhumu Al-Mukhlaşīna

translations.english_saheeh: Except, among them, Your chosen servants."
translations.english_hilali_khan: "Except Your chosen slaves amongst them (i.e. faithful, obedient, true believers of Islâmic Monotheism)."
translations.english_rwwad: except Your chosen slaves among them.”

arabic_text: قَالَ فَٱلۡحَقُّ وَٱلۡحَقَّ أَقُولُ
phonetic: 38.84 Qāla Fālĥaqqu Wa Al-Ĥaqqa 'Aqūlu

translations.english_saheeh: [Allāh] said, "The truth [is My oath], and the truth I say -
translations.english_hilali_khan: (Allâh) said: "The Truth is - and the Truth I say -
translations.english_rwwad: Allah said, “This truth is – and I only say the truth –

arabic_text: لَأَمۡلَأَنَّ جَهَنَّمَ مِنكَ وَمِمَّن تَبِعَكَ مِنۡهُمۡ أَجۡمَعِينَ
phonetic: 38.85 La'amla'anna Jahannama Minka Wa Mimman Tabi`aka Minhum 'Ajma`īna

translations.english_saheeh: [That] I will surely fill Hell with you and those of them that follow you all together."
translations.english_hilali_khan: That I will fill Hell with you [Iblîs (Satan)] and those of them (mankind) that follow you, together."
translations.english_rwwad: that I will certainly fill Hell with you and those of them who follow you all together.”

arabic_text: قُلۡ مَآ أَسۡـَٔلُكُمۡ عَلَيۡهِ مِنۡ أَجۡرٖ وَمَآ أَنَا۠ مِنَ ٱلۡمُتَكَلِّفِينَ
phonetic: 38.86 Qul Mā 'As'alukum `Alayhi Min 'Ajrin Wa Mā 'Anā Mina Al-Mutakallifīna

translations.english_saheeh: Say, [O Muḥammad], "I do not ask you for it [i.e., the Qur’ān] any payment, and I am not of the pretentious.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Say (O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم): "No wage do I ask of you for this (the Qur’ân), nor am I one of the Mutakallifûn (those who pretend and fabricate things which do not exist).
translations.english_rwwad: Say [O Prophet], “I do not ask you for any reward for it, nor do I pretend to be what I am not.

arabic_text: إِنۡ هُوَ إِلَّا ذِكۡرٞ لِّلۡعَٰلَمِينَ
phonetic: 38.87 'In Huwa 'Illā Dhikrun Lil`ālamīna

translations.english_saheeh: It is but a reminder to the worlds.
translations.english_hilali_khan: "It (this Qur’ân) is only a Reminder for all the ‘Âlamîn (mankind and jinn).
translations.english_rwwad: It is only a reminder for all people.

arabic_text: وَلَتَعۡلَمُنَّ نَبَأَهُۥ بَعۡدَ حِينِۭ
phonetic: 38.88 Wa Lata`lamunna Naba'ahu Ba`da Ĥīnin

translations.english_saheeh: And you will surely know [the truth of] its information after a time."
translations.english_hilali_khan: "And you shall certainly know the truth of it after a while".
translations.english_rwwad: And you will surely know its truth after a while.”
